name: PromptTemplate

definition.name: PromptTemplate

args.description: Unique name for the prompt template
Description of what this prompt template is used for
Human message components for the prompt
System message components for the prompt

validators.name: name_not_empty
system_message_validation

definition.description: Definition for structured prompt templates to be used in LLM interactions

description: Definition for structured prompt templates to be used in LLM interactions

name: MasterPromptTemplate

definition.name: MasterPromptTemplate

args.description: Unique name for the prompt template
Description of what this prompt accomplishes

args.example: Please analyze this article about neural networks and suggest how I can improve it for better search visibility while keeping it accessible to beginners.
args.purpose: Provides the specific prompt or question from the user
args.description: The specific question or instruction from the human

args.example: Your goal is to help the user increase the article's search visibility while maintaining its educational value.
args.purpose: Provides broader context for why the task matters
args.description: The overall goal or objective of the task

args.example: Your role is that of an expert content strategist with deep knowledge of SEO principles and content marketing.
args.purpose: Defines the specific perspective and expertise the LLM should adopt

args.example: Analyze the provided article to identify key topics, determine search intent, and suggest content improvements.
args.purpose: Clearly defines the action the LLM should take
args.description: The specific task the LLM is being asked to perform

args.purpose: Describes resources or methods available to the LLM
args.description: Tools or capabilities the LLM can use

args.example: Format your recommendations as a JSON object with the following structure: { "topics": [], "intent": "", "recommendations": [] }
args.purpose: Specifies exact formatting requirements for parsing

args.example: Provide your analysis in these sections: 1) Key Topics Identified, 2) Search Intent Analysis, 3) Content Improvement Recommendations.
args.purpose: Structures how the LLM should present its output

args.example: The article is targeting beginners in machine learning who have programming experience but limited mathematical background.
args.purpose: Provides essential background knowledge or constraints
args.description: Critical information the LLM needs to know

args.example: [CONTEXT: The following is the article to analyze: {context}]
args.purpose: Marks where retrieved or dynamically generated context should be inserted
args.description: Placeholder for dynamic context to be injected

args.example: Remember to keep suggestions practical and aligned with the user's goals rather than generic SEO advice.
args.purpose: Offers final guidance or reinforces key aspects of the task
args.description: Final instructions before the human message

args.example: You are using Claude, a helpful AI assistant created by Anthropic.
args.purpose: Sets the foundation for the LLM's understanding of its role

args.example: Ensure your recommendations are actionable and suitable for implementation by someone with the user's stated expertise level.
args.description: Any additional instructions for the LLM

args.example: [CONTROLLED CONTEXT: Specific guidelines for this article: {controlled_context}]
args.purpose: Enables fine-grained control over context inserted by the application
args.description: Placeholder for manually controlled context injection

validators.name: components_validation

definition.description: Definition for a comprehensive prompt template with system and human message components

description: Definition for a comprehensive prompt template with system and human message components

name: PromptChain

definition.name: PromptChain

args.description: Unique name for the prompt chain
Ordered list of prompt steps in the chain
Description of what this prompt chain accomplishes
Schema defining expected input fields for the chain
Schema defining the expected output structure
Pattern for executing the chain steps
Strategy for resolving prompt template versions

validators.name: chain_steps_validation
input_mapping_validation

definition.description: Definition for a chain of prompt templates to be executed sequentially

parallel.behavior: Define parallel steps that don't depend on each other's outputs
parallel.description: Multiple prompts execute simultaneously with the same input

branching.behavior: Define conditions in input_mapping to determine which branch to take
branching.description: Chain can split based on conditions from previous outputs

sequential.behavior: Each step must complete before the next begins
sequential.description: Execute prompts one after another, passing outputs as inputs to the next step

description: Definition for a chain of prompt templates to be executed sequentially
